document.heading: Historic Landmark and Historic District Protection Act of 1978

history.narrative: Law 2-144, the “Historic Landmark and Historic District Protection Act of 1978,” was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 2-367, which was referred to the Committee on Housing and Urban Development. The Bill was adopted on first, amended first, and second readings on October 31, 1978, November 14, 1978 and November 28, 1978, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on December 27, 1978, it was assigned Act No. 2-318 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review.
